audio_description: NAMASKARAM. Today's recipe is one of the favourite dishes of non-veg eaters — Chicken Biryani. I'm preparing Chicken Biryani using Basmati rice. Guys, my name is Shan Gio and welcome to the video.

audio_description: Chicken Biryani is made using half of 1 chicken, around 600 grams. This serves 3 people. From 20 pieces of a full chicken, 10 are used. In hotels, 1 chicken is usually cut into 12 pieces. At home, chicken takes longer to cook. Add 1 tsp of ginger-garlic paste.

audio_description: ¼ tsp Turmeric Powder. Beginners, be careful not to confuse tsp with tbsp. 1 tsp Coriander Powder. 1 tsp Chilli Powder. 1 tsp Garam Masala. (Garam Masala recipe is linked in the description.) 1 tsp Salt. 1 tsp Lime Juice.

audio_description: Now mix well so the masala coats the chicken pieces evenly. Refrigerate for 1 hour to let it marinate. Meanwhile, slice 4 medium-sized onions. Fry 2 of them.

audio_description: Now fry some cashew nuts and raisins (optional). Heat 1 tbsp ghee. Fry cashews until golden, then add raisins. Once raisins change color, transfer immediately to a bowl to prevent burning.

audio_description: 4 gms, 2 cardamoms (slightly cracked), 1 tomato, a bit of coriander seeds — not too much, half a pinch is enough. Lastly, a bay leaf — it gives great flavour to the biryani. We'll cook the chicken with these in a non-stick pan with a lid, which will also be used to dum (steam) the biryani.

audio_description: While chicken cooks for 10–12 minutes, start cooking rice. Use 2¼ cups water for 2 cups rice. To this, add 1 bay leaf, a 1½ inch curry leaf piece, 4 cloves, 2 cardamoms (cracked), and 1 tbsp fried onion.

audio_description: Add 1½ tsp lime juice to prevent rice from sticking. Add 1 tbsp of the fried onion oil for flavour. Add 1 tsp salt (measure properly). Wait for the water to boil. By now, the chicken will be half-cooked. Add half of the fried onion to it.
